intro: Neodunnia, commonly known as the common dunnia, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the summer. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, where it thrives in moist, shady environments. Neodunnia species are often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and habitat restoration.
